incidents.name: Postgres Database unavailable for some users

incident_updates.body: Neon has identified the issue and providing us with updates. Please continue to monitor our status page and theirs for details: their status page here: https://neonstatus.com/aws-us-east-n-virginia

Neon has put up a status page indicating that their Postgres database is unavailable for some users. For more information, please visit their status page here: https://neonstatus.com/aws-us-east-n-virginia/incidents/01J5903FVM0B3HG8VS8D57HBMS

incidents.name: Blob Storage Creation Errors

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We are currently investigating reports of elevated error rates when attempting to create new Blob stores on the Vercel Dashboard. Existing stores and live traffic are not affected by this issue. We will share updates as they become available.

incidents.name: Increased 400s across Middleware and Edge Function invocations

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved. We have published a report in our blog: https://vercel.com/blog/update-regarding-vercel-service-disruption-on-august-7-2024
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We have identified the root cause and are working on resolving the issue
We are investigating elevated 400s for Middleware and Edge Function invocations in all regions. Please continue to monitor our status page for updates.

incidents.name: Environment Variable modification errors

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

We are currently investigating reports from some customers experiencing errors when updating their environment variables. We appreciate your patience and encourage you to monitor our status page for the latest updates.

incidents.name: Increased edge middleware and edge functions failures

incident_updates.body:
There was an increase in Edge Middleware and Edge Functions failures between 2024-07-24 18:53 - 2024-07-24 19:53 PM UTC.

1. Between 2024-07-24 19:13 and 2024-07-24 19:27 PM UTC, requests served from the cpt1 (Cape Town, South Africa) Vercel region may have seen 400 errors on URLs that use Edge Middleware or Edge Functions.

2. Between 2024-07-24 18:53 - 2024-07-24 19:53 PM UTC, Edge Functions specifying the execution region in the function code may have seen 400 errors in any regions.

We've identified the root cause and have rolled out a fix.

affected_components.name: Edge Network - CPT1 - Cape Town, South Africa

incident_updates.body: A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

affected_components.name: Edge Network - CPT1 - Cape Town, South Africa

incident_updates.body: We are currently investigating the edge function and middleware failures in CPT1 and will provide updates as they are received.

affected_components.name: Edge Network - CPT1 - Cape Town, South Africa

incidents.name: Elevated INTERNAL_EDGE_FUNCTION_INVOCATION_FAILED errors

incident_updates.body: There has been an increase in internal Edge Function failures between 03:26 and 03:38 2024-07-24 UTC. This incident has been resolved.

incidents.name: Elevated INTERNAL_EDGE_FUNCTION_INVOCATION_FAILED errors

incident_updates.body:
This incident has been resolved.

The cause of this incident was different from the last incident that happened on 2024-07-10: https://www.vercel-status.com/incidents/d960v5739qdb

Unlike the last incident, the issue did not impact new deployments. Customers may have seen a small amount of INTERNAL_EDGE_FUNCTION_INVOCATION_FAILED errors on existing deployments during the following windows:

- 2024-07-17 14:30 ~ 2024-07-17 15:40 UTC
- 2024-07-17 19:46 ~ 2024-07-17 22:50 UTC

The issue was resolved by reverting a recent bad release.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
Edge Functions & Edge Middleware are degraded, and may return INTERNAL_EDGE_FUNCTION_INVOCATION_FAILED error. We are actively investigating this and will provide updates as they become available.

incidents.name: Builds using pnpm with Node.js 20 intermittently encountering error

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We believe the root cause has been identified and a fix is currently being deployed
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Elevated error rates for deploying serverless functions

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are investigating elevated error rates for deploying serverless functions, resulting in some builds failing. We will continue to update and share our findings as they become available.

incidents.name: Elevated INTERNAL_EDGE_FUNCTION_INVOCATION_FAILED errors

incident_updates.body:
The incident has been resolved.

This incident affected deployments created between 2024-07-10 21:32 and 2024-07-10 22:26 UTC. Only Edge Middleware and Edge Functions are affected. Deployments created during this window may have seen elevated 500 INTERNAL_EDGE_FUNCTION_INVOCATION_FAILED errors.

If you still see the error on your project, redeploying your last deployment should resolve the issue.

A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results. For the small percentage of deployments that are still affected please perform an Instant Rollback or Redeploy your project to resolve the issue.

Edge Functions & Edge Middleware are degraded, and may return INTERNAL_EDGE_FUNCTION_INVOCATION_FAILED error. If your deployment is affected please perform an Instant Rollback to a previous deployment as a workaround.

incidents.name: Vercel Dashboard failing to load

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are aware of an issue affecting the Vercel Dashboard. We are currently investigating and will provide an update soon.

incidents.name: Intermittent empty 200 responses on ISR pages

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We have observed reports of rare, intermittent ISR responses with a status code of 200 containing no content.

We have identified the issue related to a change in our functions infrastructure and the change has been reverted.

We have automatically deployed a resolution to the issue. If you experience this again, please reach out to Vercel Support.

incidents.name: Vercel Dashboard Errors

incident_updates.body: We have fully resolved this incident.
The fix has been deployed for our Dashboards and we are currently monitoring.
We have identified the issue and have deployed a fix now.
We are aware of issues with our dashboard that may affect your ability to view preview deployments. We are actively investigating the issue.

incidents.name: Vercel Postgres outage in the SIN1 region

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Neon has implemented a fix and we're currently monitoring the results.

Due to a problem with our upstream provider, all databases in the SIN1 (Singapore) region are intermittently accessible. For more information, see the Neon status: https://neonstatus.com/aws-asia-pacific-singapore

incidents.name: Environment Variable modification errors

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We are currently experiencing issues adding, loading, or modifying environment variables. The root cause has been identified and a fix is underway. Please continue to monitor our status page for the latest updates.

incidents.name: Delayed Runtime Logs

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Our upstream provider has fixed the issue and we are currently working to restore all missing logs between 8:24 - 9:29 UTC.
We have Identified an issue where some runtime logs have been missing since 8:24 UTC. We are currently working with the upstream provider to mitigate this.

incidents.name: Delayed SSL Certificate Issuance/Update by Letsencrypt

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Our SSL Certificate provider Letsencrypt is facing a disruption. You can find more details here: https://letsencrypt.status.io/pages/incident/55957a99e800baa4470002da/66492ffd0aea6605a975e43d.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

The data generated after 14:07 UTC is now available for querying. We are currently backfilling data from 11:12 UTC to 14:07 UTC. Once completed, we will share the update here. Please continue to monitor this status page for the latest.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

We are currently investigating reports of elevated error rates on the Vercel Dashboard (Usage, Monitoring, Web Analytics & Speed Insights dashboards). Existing deployments and live traffic are not affected by this issue. We will share updates as they become available.

incidents.name: Delayed Build Processing for Pro users

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
All queued Pro builds have been processed and we are monitoring the results.

We are currently investigating elevated build queue processing times for users on the Pro plan. Existing deployments and live traffic are not affected by this issue. We will share updates as they become available.

incidents.name: Issues creating new KV stores

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
New KV stores can now be created and we are continuing to monitor.
We're investigating reports of customers not being able to create new KV stores. Existing KV stores are working fine.

incidents.name: DNS Update Delays

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are observing recovery in DNS updates due to the resolved upstream problems with our DNS provider. We are continuing to monitor.
We are observing a degradation in DNS updates due to an ongoing issue with our upstream provider. Existing DNS records are not affected by this issue. We will share updates as they become available.

incidents.name: Elevated latency and error rate in iad1 Data Cache

incident_updates.body: This lasted for 50 minutes from May 2, 20:42 - 21:32 UTC. During this time some customers may have experienced increased timeouts or errors in iad1.

incidents.name: Elevated latency and error rate for Vercel Data Cache in the IAD1 (Washington, D.C., USA) region

incident_updates.body: We have identified an issue in the IAD1 (Washington, D.C., USA) region that caused elevated latency and increased error rate for the Vercel Data Cache. This lasted for 11 minutes from 15:24 - 15:35 UTC and has since been resolved.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

incidents.name: Intermittent Log Drains Outage

incident_updates.body: From 15/05/2024 15:45 UTC to 16/05/2024 12:40 UTC. We have identified an issue with Log Drains where some logs weren't correctly sent and would have included decimals in the timestamp. This will have affected logs from Serverless Functions, Edge Functions and Middleware. This has since been resolved.

incidents.name: Some Builds with Edge Functions and Middleware Failing

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are currently monitoring.

This relates to the previous incident linked below:

incidents.name: Some Builds with Edge Functions and Middleware Failing

incident_updates.body: From 15:24 - 15:54 UTC, some new builds experienced build failure due to an issue with edge functions and middleware. This issue was identified by one of our upstream providers, and they internally investigated and fixed the issue. New builds with edge functions and middleware are now building successfully again.

incidents.name: Elevated Edge Function & Middleware Invocation Errors

incident_updates.body: During 2024-04-04 18:53 - 18:56 UTC, some Vercel deployments may have experienced elevated Edge Function and Edge Middleware invocation errors. This incident has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Elevated Edge Function Latencies and Failures in arn1 (Stockholm, Sweden - North)

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

We have identified the issue to be isolated to the ARN1 region and have temporarily redirected Edge Function and Middleware traffic to other regions. Serverless Functions are not affected and will continue to run as normal.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are currently investigating this issue which started April 2, 12:00 UTC.

incidents.name: Delayed Build Processing for Hobby users

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
All queued Hobby builds have been processed and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and the Hobby build queue is currently being processed.

We are currently investigating elevated build queue processing times for users on the Hobby plan. Existing deployments and live traffic are not affected by this issue. We will share updates as they become available.

incidents.name: Monitoring dashboard unavailable for some teams

incident_updates.body: A fix has been implemented and this incident has been resolved.

We are investigating an issue where some teams may receive errors trying to view the Monitoring page within the Vercel dashboard. A root cause has been identified, and a fix is being implemented. We will continue to share updates as they become available.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

incidents.name: Cron jobs failing with 401 errors due to missing Authorization headers

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix for this issue has been implemented. Affected Vercel customers may need to trigger a new deployment either from your Vercel Dashboard or by a new Pull Request to restore Cron job functionality.
We are currently investigating reports of Cron jobs failing with 401 errors as a result of missing Authorization headers. We will provide a further update when available.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Our upstream provider is experiencing issues which impacts the following operations:
- Delay in issuing wildcard certificates
- Delay in DNS record changes (existing records are fine)

incidents.name: Vercel Deployment Errors

This incident is now resolved, however Vercel customers may need to trigger a new deployment either from your Vercel Dashboard or by a new Pull Request.

incidents.name: GitHub Deployment and API Errors

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We're seeing a recovery of deployments via GitHub and are continuing to monitor.

GitHub is degraded. New deployments triggered from GitHub commits are delayed until the GitHub incident¹ is resolved.
You can still create deployments using the Vercel dashboard² or the Vercel CLI.
¹: https://www.githubstatus.com/incidents/wcl1sw4mzg60
²: https://vercel.com/docs/deployments/git#creating-a-deployment-from-a-git-reference

incidents.name: GitHub webhook intermittent outage

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
GitHub have confirmed affected services have recovered, and we will continue to monitor.

GitHub is degraded. New deployments triggered from GitHub commits are delayed until the GitHub incident¹ is resolved.
You can still create deployments using the Vercel dashboard² or the Vercel CLI.
¹: https://www.githubstatus.com/incidents/5lc3f39mjcq8
²: https://vercel.com/docs/deployments/git#creating-a-deployment-from-a-git-reference

incidents.name: Elevated Build Queue Times

incident_updates.body: Deployments appearing as “QUEUED” have recovered, and all new deployments are now working as expected. The incident has been resolved.
The issue has been identified and a fix is in the works. To note: this issue is only present on builds using Node 20. Builds using Node 18 and below are functioning normally.
We are currently investigating reports of queued builds. We will share updates as they become available.

You can still create deployments using the Vercel dashboard² or the Vercel CLI.
